title: After Jio Decides To Charge Customers For Voice Calls, #BoycottJio Starts Trending
text:
It was announced yesterday that Reliance Jio customers will now have to pay for voice calls to account for the termination charges the company pays its rivals, Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea.

In a statement on Wednesday, the telecom company, which had promised to keep all the voice calls free, said it was “compelled” to start charging its over 350 million users.

The users now have to pay Rs 6 paise per minute, till the other rivals bring the fee down to zero. But it said that it will give its users additional data, just to ensure there's no “effective increase” in tariffs for its customers.

Calls from Jio to Jio, to landlines and those made over apps such as WhatsApp will remain free.
